p: The seed oil content and fatty acid composition were determined for six P. harmala populations collected from different regions in Tunisia. Data analysis indicated that seed oil content varied among localities and ranged from 5.75% to 14.75% for GF and KO, respectively, with an average of 12.51% ( Table 1). These results were similar to a previous report [ 17], in which oil content was 10%. This finding supported the use of P. harmala as a new source of vegetable oil.
